title: Good idea, good demonstration, good score
review:
This paper is the first showing that achieving self-generated tasks during spontaneous exploration and getting reinforced by self-supervised signals is a promising way for the agent to develop skills itself.
The scores are demonstrative on several tasks.
It opens interesting direction for further research.

REM: 
few typos like "An state"
Please plot in dash the count methods in the graphs (use oracle information)

Annexe C shall be integrated into the core of the paper. Could be simplified.
The cosine metrics shall be better integrated in it.
confidence: 3: The reviewer is fairly confident that the evaluation is correct
